title: Did a 1940s U.S. War Department Film Compare Anti-Minority Hate Speech to Nazi Propaganda?
subtitle: The World War II-era short film "Don't Be a Sucker" cited Nazi propaganda as an example of how hatred of minority groups is used to stoke political fanaticism.
author: David Emery
vclaim: A U.S. War Department film from the 1940s warns Americans that political rhetoric condemning minorities and foreigners is a precursor to fascist movements like Nazism.
